About this item

  • Smart Home Alarm System - A smart way to protect your house with CPVAN Smart Home Security System. 9-piece kit includes the 1 motion sensor alarm siren, 6 windows & door sensors and 2 remote controls. (You can add up to 24 door/window sensors and 10 remotes to the central alarm host.)
  • Loud Home Alarm - The CPVAN Wi-Fi Smart Home Security System doubles as a motion detector and an alarm. When the door/window sensors get removed from each other or when the hub detects motion, the alarm hub emits 120-decibel alarm and simultaneously sending push notifications to your smartphone.
  • DIY Installation - Easily set up CPVAN Wireless Home Security System in minutes. The alarm station should ALWAYS CONNECT to AC adapter via the cable in the package. The backup batteries of the alarm hub works for 8 hours, only as an emergency battery.
  • If No Wifi - If a power or wifi outage occurs, your alarm will continue to function for up to 8 hours on backup battery power, emitting a 120dB alarm to deter intruders when it detects motion or when the door or window is opened.(No app alerts without wifi)
  • No Monthly Fees - CPVAN WiFi Alarm System is a one-time purchase at no extra fee. Arm and disarm your alarm system by the remotes or directly from your phone via the Smart Life App.No contracts and No subscription fee. We offer a 60-day money back guarantee, a 3-year manufacturer warranty, as well as lifetime customer support.

  • What kind of power does this item need?

    You need to use the Type-C cable in the package as the power supply. 3 x 1.5V AA Alkaline Batteries only last about 8 hours at most.

  • Can this item work normally if there is not Wi-Fi?

    Sure, the item can work both with Wi-Fi and Network Disconnection Status. If there occurs outage or wifi disconnection, you won't get any APP notification and you only get on spot 120dB alarm.

  • Can I add more door/window sensors and remotes?

    You can add up to 24 door/window sensors and 10 remotes to the central alarm host. Note: Same door/window sensor and remote can be added to different host too.

  • Where should I place the host and door/window sensors?

    You should place all the items indoor. They are not waterproof. Also, you need to place the host as near as possible to the AC power.(And place the host at the place where pets won't pass by frequently.)

  • When the intruder leave, can the alarm automatically turn off?

    If you don't turn it off manually, the alarm will last 0-255s. This depends on the APP settings on your phone.

How customer reviews and ratings work

Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we dont use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

  • Dion
    2.0 out of 5 stars Random alarms make the unit unusable :(
    Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2025
    Verified Purchase
    I was excited to get this in place after first setting it up. As a low cost way to remotely monitor (phone app) my home and as a complement to a paid alarm service this seemed like a winner.

    Unfortunately, the system ended up not being usable. The very first night the motion detector went off in the middle of the night creating a scare and calls to police. I wasn't sure what triggered the alarm, but decided to have the motion detector guard a room with no windows in the event that ambient light changes were an issue. Two night later, it randomly triggered again.

    Ok, the motion detector is flaky let's just leverage the door sensors by arming "home". It still went off randomly with no motion and the doors not opened!

    The unit now sits idle and I purchased a much more expensive, but functional, Ring system to replace it :(
